716950f.text:
Broadway, east side, south across Beaver, to Stone St's., showing the New York Produce Exchange Building. Below Stone Street, this thoroughfare changes it's identity to Vhitehall Street. The latter continues southward to South Ferry. On the right is Bowling Breen Park and it's Steamship Row. Subsecuently this will be replaced with the U.S.
Custom House.
VEG ~.331E  About 1890
Thru New York Historical Society

716954f-a.text:
8-12 and 14-20 Broadway, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Beaver Street, showing at the corner the Produce Exchange Bank, and north of same
the Wells Building.
About 1920.
Gift of E.M. Jenks.

716966f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from Beaver Street as seen across Bowling Green, showing prominently three buildings, which in order are the Produce Exchange Bank, the Wells Building and the Standard Oil Building. On the right appears the north side of Beaver Street, east to but not including New Street; the two 5-story buildings between the Bank and the Wells Annex
being Nos. 1 and 3.
About 1920.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

716979f-a.text:
32-34 Broadway, east side, between Beaver Street and Exchange Place, showing the 18-story Marine and Commerce Building. This photograph is
taken from Morris Street viewing eastward.
About 1920.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

716955f-b.text:
Broadway (center to left), at and adjoining the N.E. corner of B8aver Street (center to right) as viewed across Bowling Green and showing the Produce Exchange Bank and Welles Building (No's 8-12 and 14-20 Broadway) under demolition. The additional structures on the north side of Beaver Street, between Broadway and New Street were included slightly later and form the present (1937) site of the south building (24 stories) of the Standard Oil Company. The small 5 story structure appearing between the Bank (corner) and the ell of the Standard Oil Company Building is No. 3 Beaver Street. This set consists of a negative and a positive.
About 1923.
Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

716955f-a.text:
Broadway (center to left), at and adjoining the N.E. corner of B8aver Street (center to right) as viewed across Bowling Green and showing the Produce Exchange Bank and Welles Building (No's 8-12 and 14-20 Broadway) under demolition. The additional structures on the north side of Beaver Street, between Broadway and New Street were included slightly later and form the present (1937) site of the south building (24 stories) of the Standard Oil Company. The small 5 story structure appearing between the Bank (corner) and the ell of the Standard Oil Company Building is No. 3 Beaver Street. This set consists of a negative and a positive.
About 1923.
Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

716964f-b.text:
Broadway, at the N.E. corner of Beaver Street, showing a clearance where the former Produce Exchange Bank stood. This in conjunction with No. 3 Beaver Street (the 5 story affair) forms the present (1937) site of the south building of the Standard Oil Company. This set consists of
'a negative and a positive.
About 1923.
Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

716964f-a.text:
Broadway, at the N.E. corner of Beaver Street, showing a clearance where the former Produce Exchange Bank stood. This in conjunction with No. 3 Beaver Street (the 5 story affair) forms the present (1937) site of the south building of the Standard Oil Company. This set consists of
'a negative and a positive.
About 1923.
Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

716949f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, south from Beaver, to and including Stone Streets. Also shown is Whitehall Street, (continuation of Broadway), east side, south from and including Stone, tp, but not including Bridge Streets. Prominent building shown is the'produoeexchange, with a portion of Bowling Green in the immediate foreground.
October 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

716959f-a.text:
Broadway, north from Beaver (right) to Morris Streets (center), showing at the N.W. corner of the latter point, the curved apex of the 15-story Columbia Building, No. 29 Broadway. The 6-story structure adjacent to same, is the Bank Marmorosh, No. 31-33. Note the new 38-story Fred. F. French Building north of the latter. On the left is the Cunard Building structure that faces the curved Standard Oil Building shown on the right.
April 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

716952f-a.text:
U.S. Customs House Statue; in rear is New York Produce
Exchange Building
2 Broadway, Manhattan
Federal Art Project
"Changing New York
Berenice Abbott, photographer
Neg. No. 1
[Note: negative at Museum of the City ofNew fork]
Code I B and 1 A-3
July 23, 1936

716622f.text:
1 Beaver Street, north side, between Broadway and New Street, showing demolition preparatory to erecting the present home of
ths Standard Oil Company.
Wurts Brothers  June 10, 1904

716624f-a.text:
Beaver Street, w. to roadway
Photographer unknown
n.d.
